Review Text:
Visited before visiting Old Trafford Cricket ground.

Nice little Wetherspoon's with plenty of staff and quick service.

We ordered on the app and food arrived very quickly under 10 mins. Food was cooked to perfection and prices were very good and value for money.

Will definitely visit again if in the area.

Great pub we didn't eat but it's a spoons so you know what you get.. Great staff, cheap prices and leffe on tap. As ever the toilets (Next postcode) miles away if you need a nature break... handy location for man utd if you like them? Or City for shopping
The best pub in Manchester Ben and his team look after you from the minute you arrive especially on United home games
Great pre-match atmosphere. Low priced drinks. Easily accessible outside balcony. Friendly hard-working staff

Really good food, excelent beers, magic location, wonderful employees and amazing man utd supporters

Perfect alchemy, perfect Place
A superb place located very close to Old Trafford. We came here after our stadium tour. Prices were really affordable and the atmosphere all around was excellent.
Just awesome!!! Home for every Manchester United fan.

Amazing atmosphere at the pub close to the Theatre of Dreams üòç
Nice and spacious, well lit and very lively ambience. The chicken Tikka is really nice (believe me when I say this). I tried the warm chocolate fudge cake with ice cream and it just melts in your mouth. ‚Ä¶
Great place to visit as a Man U fan. Food was excellent and very reasonably prices.
Absolutely phenomenal branch of spoons, 3 mins walk from the Theatre. The pics of Sir Paul Scholes, Rooney and Sir Alexander Ferguson were straight into my phone gallery. Love it.

Great pub a couple of minutes walk from old Trafford football stadium. Excellent bar staff & a good variety of food/drink at very reasonable prices. Would definitely recommend a visit anytime of the day or night.
Relax restaurant, have beer and the price for all food is not expensive but tasty
Good Wetherspoon pub near Old Trafford Stadium. Much better sports coverage on TV than most Wetherspoons.

The place to be before any game in Old Trafford.Fantsstic atmosphere  for about 4 hours before kick off.Drink goo,service is fast,gaffer and staff very nice and friendly.A must visit if going to Old Trafford.
Proper drinks and food for fair prices.
Great atmosphere, as always, before the Utd vs Real Betis game
Excellent Wetherspoons,best I've been in across the UK. A Carlsberg and a mixed berries pint was costing us less than a ¬£5

There couldn't be a better place to be at before a match at Old Trafford. This is the most buzzing and the best place to be at for Manchester United matches.

The entire pub is divided into two levels, an expansive lower level and a smaller upper level. During matchday, entry is restrictive. The crowd comes in big numbers, so there is an extra long queue. Make sure you reach early to get inside and IT'S ABSOLUTELY WORTH BEING HERE.
Not the greatest atmosphere, however the food is cost effective and the service is really good
The place is nice but some staffs are cool. Food prices are reasonable.

Really amazing atmosphere close to Old Trafford, you can see mainly locals here so it gives an ‚Äúauthentic‚Äù experience!

Also, the prices are really good, this is NOT a tourist trap, I loved this place!
great pub, Lovely food and very near Old Trafford
Delicious fish, chips, mashy pees and beer! Came all the way from SA to try this! Highly recommended!
Such a fantastic spot for a beer üç∫ and the food is good // had about 10 large bottle of Heineken 630cl Hugh man was buckled üòÇüòÇü§òüèª ‚Ä¶
Must be the best pub before and after a match in Old Trafford.Food,drink,staff and singing the best ever.Great atmosphere. Well worth a visit.
Just went in for cool drink lovely efficient staff nice pub
A fantastic place before the manu match

What amazing service we just received here. My son ordered the chicken breast bites but there were not enough left for a full portion. The lady (? manager) who fed back the information was extremely helpful - we were happy to take a smaller portion of chicken bites with extra chips, but she still refunded us for this meal and really wanted to make sure we were happy - thanks so much!

Steak night on the eve of Barmy Boris's New plan of choas lovely large mixed grill well cooked and tasty.
friendly bar pleasant staff.
Yeah it's a weather spoons. Cheap and cheerful. And friendly staff
Best place to be before home games ‚ù§Ô∏èüñ§
Very good prices and easy to order with fast service
Great atmosphere on match days both food and drink very reasonabley priced

If you are a Manchester United supporter then this pub is a must to visit. It‚Äôs adjacent to Old Trafford and has a wide range of quality pints for cheap prices. The staff are courteous and professional as well. When I go to Manchester I make it a point to visit The Bishop Blaize and I give my highest recommendation to The Bishop Blaize so if you‚Äôre in Manchester go have a pint!

After visiting a quite a few Wetherspoons on my travels, so far this has to be the best in terms of food quality. I had a large mixed grill and it was delicious (not over done like most). We ordered on the app and within 20 mins we had our food and drink which is remarkable, especially for a weekend.

The only thing that let it down was how tired the staff looked, but don‚Äôt let it put you off! Highly recommend!

Great spoons housed between the football and cricket grounds.

Great selection of real ales and usual spoons food which hit the spot when I visited.

Nice area out the front to sit outside and toilets that are not a million miles away.

Great pub for Manchester United match days. Punk IPA was only 3.80 for a pint. Lots of singing and quick service!

PS: You need a match day ticket to get in.
Nice pub. Super staff. Dirty toilets. Food and drink ok.
What a pub for a true utd fan, once a red always a red
One of the better places to go to before a game

Called in today not expecting much as we felt underwhelmed recently at our trip to the Tim bobbin. This place know exactly how to run a wetherspoon. From the manager down to the chef Ian, Food and drink were very good well done on the good standards.
Good staff relaxed atmosphere 10out of 10 üëçüç∫just the ticket üéü ‚Ä¶
A little quiet but service and food great

Stopped for something to eat and drink before going to 02 Victoria warehouse
Nice little pub belonging to the weatherspoon chain..
Cheap beer.. Cheap pub food with a great atmosphere..
What Moor do you want..
The place was very busy being a Friday night but we were able to find a table.. Used the weather spoon app for ordering food and drinks..
Got served within minutes of ordering..
Drinks first and then food not long after
The food was enjoyable enough and for the price it was more than value for money
Toilets were on the second floor with a disabled toilet on the ground floor..
From what I saw.. You have to ask behind the bar for the key..
For sure worth a visit and the staff are friendly and polite.. Which can make all the difference..
Good beer, good price. Food cheap and cheerful, served quickly. And  Flfree WiFi.
Great experience here. Had a really nice breakfast, then later in the day went back for dinner and drinks. Good service.
Seriously good food and good beer. Considering it is a Wetherspoon I was surprised also. That was one of the best value meals I had in UK.
Good atmosphere after the game, good chat and beers.
Greatest place for UNITED fans. Happy to meet MANUTD legends there
Great value breakfasts with free refills
It was quite busy, not surprising wi cheap beer, good atmosphere and didn't take too long to get served. Oh and they had newky brooon.. champion..
Brilliant pub. Brilliant atmosphere pre-match. Cheap as well. ‚ù§üñ§GGMU ‚Ä¶

Fantastic pub. Food is very tasty and cheap! Lots of veggie/Vegan options and are clearly labelled on the menu. Lovely atmosphere. Always made to feel welcome. Staff are always friendly and helpful. Very clean and tidy. Toilets are always spotless. Never had a problem. Would recommend 100%
Missed a spoons breakfast and this one was super. Very clean, tidy, quick service.
Best pub to go to on match days and in the week if you want something to eat. Landlord great nice one Ben.
Amazing place for n a match day! I wouldn't go anywhere else! But be there early!

5 minutes from home, Breakfast brilliant served quick and hot, free refills tea and coffee. Clean toilets,clean and tidy seating areas Prices over a pound less than Chorlton. Nice friendly staff, never any trouble, enjoy your drink inside or out, what more do you want.
Loved this place food was perfect great atmosphere too.

I love going here before going to see a Man United match. The atmosphere is insane and really gets you into the mood for the game. It is always very busy on game day and you sometimes have to queue but this usually isn't for very long. It's only ¬£1 entry and the prices of the beer inside is reasonable just like any other wetherspoons. I would recommend buying the cans from the bar in the middle as these are only ¬£2.50 for Stella!! If you want to get in the singing mood for the game then this is the place to go, the singing and chanting doesn't stop!
Wonderful place to visit for something to eat and a drink
Nice , clean , speedy service and friendly staff. Definitely recommended
Brilliant place place to watch united if you can't get tickets for the games.
Great day fares, steak on Tuesday, fish on Friday, etc.
great place great staff nice pint of guinness ... highly reccommend

It's a mad house on match day, I love it. People singing and chanting their favourite football songs at full pelt is what it should be about everywhere. No speech police or ' PC ' prawn sandwich eating killjoys telling you that the song is not ' politically correct. ' I myself am a bit of an introvert so don't sing, I just churn inside and go through the pain of each game, especially on Derby Day or against Liverpool, but watching people absolutely loving it and going mental is a joy to watch. Please bishops blaze, don't ever close and don't ever stop such an amazing act....the ales are not bad either, and at ¬£1.99  a pop, can't be bad!!
The best place to go pre match. Very cheap drinks (still plenty fresh) in a buzzing Man U fan atmosphere. Nothing else quite like it.
Great food reasonably priced good service

The service here was really lovely.  The food was nice enough and really cheap.  Great value.  There was a wide selection of drinks and overall I had a really good evening here without breaking the bank.

Amazing atmosphere on match day. Busy as anything. But a good crack. Doesn't tend to take long to get served considering there is usually a good queue to get in. Definitely helps if you know the songs.

Great place for manu supporters to visit on match day prior to the match. You'll need supporter club membership evidence/match ticket and a small fee to get inside, and be very early to avoid long queue. Affordable drinks (mostly beer) and great atmosphere created by supporters chanting and singing. There is normally a guy called Peter Boyle that starts the singing and keeps it going. He was unfortunately not present the last time i was there which resulted in more sporadic and less organized supporter chanting/singing, and not the same good experience.
The best pub for the United games , always rocking and met some great people in there.
Best place for cheap beers on match days... This place can't be touched for value for money for food and drink.

The food is up to the usual Wetherspoons standards, which is hard to beat for quality and price. The staff were all very pleasant. The d√©cor is very much Man United themed, given its proximity to the ground that is small wonder, it does get packed out on match days.
Nice to be back! Friendly staff as always and adhering to social distancing well. Really nice food and quick service. Can't wait until we can go out properly again
FAB FRIENDLY PLACE WITH GORGEOUS FOOD SPEEDY SERVICE & THE BEST MEMBER OF STAFF 'LARISSA' SUPER FRIENDLY ALWAYS HAPPY & SMILING GOT LOTS OF TIME FOR OUR DAUGHTER EVERY VISIT ‚ù§Ô∏èüòò ‚Ä¶
Amazing place friendly staff super clean n fresh highly recommend
Good food. Friendly staff. Wide selection of beers. Great picture of Eric Cantona on the wall. They've started doing pizzas too. What's not to like?

Super place for MU fans.Great pub to watch football,with lots of t.v's and big screen. Good food,good pint and cheap as well. The toilets are spotless and bar staff are very friendly. Cant find a complaint with it at all.Well worth a visit.
Brilliant if you like pre match singing and a pint when the football is not on still really busy for food which is lovely
Great atmosphere for pre match pint
Great place to eat and drink Staff are good too üëç ‚Ä¶
Good food, good prices would recommend.

Positive Vibe place. Kiddu. Affordable rate among other bars. Delicious food. Ordering via Wetherspoon app is efficient.

Try to visit once.
Great location for football or cricket
Nicest wetherspoons breakfast iv ever had. Eggs perfect.
Very busy pub but a good atmosphere.
Called in before the United game on Wednesday.  Great atmosphere and banter.

Once again excellent service and meal thanks to Ben and his team I took twenty ladies for lunch and not one complaint food was well cooked and presented staff were wonderful can't wait till our next visit
Clean and tidy. Food is good quality and service is fast,efficient and friendly
A must visit before you go to the game at Old Trafford. Incredible atmosphere with the fans and a really good bar selection.
Very well presented Wetherspoons pub. Clean, light and airy with a small front garden. The food is some of the best I've had in spoons. Staff are polite, efficient and friendly. Recommended!

What a pub where most Manchester United fans go and its bouncing with singing and good crack  have to see it and the meals aren't bad neither looks different when there isn't no football on and the gaffer best in the world our Ben
Great any time but especially for a few beers before the game
City Derby game.. My first visit to OT from India had a brilliant pre match drinking session.. Love all the chants and singing..

Thematic restaurant - Fans of MANCHESTER UNITED meet up there before every match. The restaurant offers several types of beer and also meals. We ordered a soup and desert and it was very tasty and NOT expensive!! Recommende to visit - mostly for MUFC fans - but not possible to get there on match day :-) it si totally full.
By far the most loved and cherished pub to visit if your a man Utd fan!! Excellent atmosphere great prices and all the best beers under 1 roof.. visit n lift the roof!!
Came to England to watch a Man U match and have a great fan experience....Bishop Blaize and the fans there did not disappoint.  Great atmosphere and was thoroughly impressed by the food also....
Great man united pub with brilliant people
Good food and a fine selection of beer. On matchdays the atmosphere is fantastic but get there early and make sure you have your match ticket.

Really big thank you to Ben and the staff for supporting Gorgeous Gorse Hill community/guerilla gardeners with bottles of water for the volunteers as well as a good few watering cans' worth for the plants. Much appreciated on world cup final day.

Went there with 2 kids,1st time after lockdown.atmosphere very relaxed,friendly bunch of customers and really helpful staff.nice smoking area.great food at great price.garlic bread seemed freshly made.jacket potatoe needed butter and more cheese but side salad and sauce was good.chips good too.cant wait to try the veggie breakfast next time were in trafford.wine was nice&staff so accommodating to my daughter and nephew,even when my 4 year old wanted to askfor her own vinegar&straws;they spoke to her with the same respect they would give an adult.cant wait to visit this place again and try another dish.amazing bar staff and chefs
Lovely pub with a very warm atmosphere. It Did take a while to get a drink at the bar, the staff were very apologetic for being understaffed. The pub was exceptionally busy due to the nice weather.
Awesome food at great prices. Fantastic pizza & apple crumble dessert. Draft cider & beer at great price. A must visit for every Man Utd fan
Great place and cool pictures of Manchester United FC, just down the road to see the football ground.

Last week was the first time I managed to visit Bishop Blaize. The bar is super crowded , the atmosphere is electric and the entertainment on match days for Manchester Utd supporters is one not to miss. You have to queue to get into the bar but it is a must for any home supporters. Just remember to bring your One Utd membership as proof of entry.

Another enjoyable visit to our local Wetherspoon. We had Pizza from the new menu,  excellent food and service as ever! Being vegetarian we are well catered for here as at all Wetherspoons,  and the addition of Pizza is a great bonus üëçüëèüçª ‚Ä¶
Excellent service. Right next to the theatre of dreams. Best place to hang out.
Quick service, helped by the app which means avoiding queuing at the bar. Decent food reasonable price and usually a pretty good atmosphere being next to old trafford
Very good hearty delicious meal, with a large beer, not expensive with a very good atmosphere to advise .
Came across this diamond of spoons just 5 mins from gold Trafford cheap beer good freindly staff service while I charge my phone up n keep me dry spot on
Ridiculous idea to have a poker game (taking up almost all the tables) when all the ian brown fans wanna have a drink and something to eat.
The real McCoy ManUnited pub...superb atmosphere on match days.
When Manchester United games are on  you need to show your match ticket to get in and it gets very crowded.
good atmosphere, good food and nice beers
Just what you‚Äôd expect from a spoons. Food was fast and fresh and of course great value.
Great place,staff and food.resonable prices and very clean.kid friendly.i always go here when im in trafford.good choices for veggies and kids menu
Just your typical wetherspoons. I've eaten here a couple of times and never had any issues with anything. It's very popular on match days due to being next to Old Trafford.
Loved this place! Very reasonably priced drinks especially the cocktail pitchers which were delicious. The pizzas were amazing and came out so fast.
Superb location of MANCHESTER UNITED,great staff..very good prices for lager and friendly staff..would recommend espeially if u support MUFC üëçüëèüëè ‚Ä¶
Always a great Wetherspoons to visit even though it is a United pub but customers and staff are brilliant.

Leah is such a good barmaid!
She made me and all my friends so welcome and did us some lovely shots!!!
Defo coming back soon!!!
Great food and drinks at unbeatable prices. Great service

Exclusively for Manchester United supporters, a couple of hours before any home match. In any other time, a chill place to have many different beers at a reasonable price, maybe lunch with your partner.
Top place. Great people. Great staff . beers good. Food good.  Avoid on match day unless you're going to the game.
Great service, and I lived the United atmosphere! Enjoy the GameDay experience as well. Must visit!
Amazing atmosphere prior to Manchester United match plus minutes from Old Trafford, definitely will go there again next time I am on vacation to attend a match!
It had a nice, homely feel to it and the staff were very helpful and friendly... even when I made a mistake with my order
If atmosphere is your thing then dont miss out, a must for all football fans in particular Manchester United supporters, best atmosphere on the planet.

Up here for a few days working; staying at Hotel Football. Fiver a pint in the hotel bar for naff Tetleys or a 3 minute walk for a choice of FIVE Real Ales from ¬£1.79-¬£1.99? No-brainer really, isn't it.  üòâ ‚Ä¶
Good selection of beers at a decent price, all major sporting events are shown on a number of screens and a great place to go for a pre match pint when United are at home
This place is an absolute MUST if you are a Man Utd fan. Unbelievable atmosphere and good prices
Good pub great selection of beers and the service was excellent
Nice pub, good food, lovely toilets. Mind your head!!
Love it, great atmosphere, always good to get in the mood before a game
Go here before a United home game, season ticket must be shown to doormen to get in, no paper tickets accepted, top atmosphere
A weatherspoons pub Manchester had breakfast there it was delicious good quality food and staff üòã ‚Ä¶
Very impressed with the pleasant attitude of Staff and their strict Security vetting of patrons.A very animated place of various Nationalities enjoying the Beautiful Game on TV.Keep on the Good work.
Great pub before a Manchester United game and nothing Peter than seeing Pete Boyle in his element but the pub even during its quiet times is a great place to have a feed and a pint.
A Manchester United pub, so be aware of football memorabilia. Nice atmosphere though and reasonably priced food and drinks.
We look forward to our cars having their mot's done simply because we get to have breakfast in The Bishop Blaize. Staff very professional.
A great pub to visit before a gig at the Victoria warehouse. I bet it's amazing for United matches as well
Fantastic Weatherspoon close to MUFC. Great food & friendly staff. Went there twice over 2 days whilst watching BGT in The Lowry. Defo go again
Amazing atmosphere after the match at Old Trafford
A great pub for united fans! Really nice inside, great food and drinks! And the atmosphere during and after the united games is amazing
Classic pub for a beer before a Man U game.
Great pub good food cheap beers
Great pub. Always a good crowd and really friendly staff. Probably my favourite Spoons.
If you love a drink, banter and my immortal beloved Manchester United, then you will love this place... All Manchester United fans need to come here for a drink before any Manchester United game

Visit most lunch times, the staff are so on the ball in such a busy place and always polite, great prices and food for a quick bite to eat and now do pizzas that are amazing add a pint for an extra ¬£1
A great little Wetherspoons, not too far from my work so often go here for a drink after work. Good atmosphere, fast service, good food.
We call  in here whilst waiting to pick kids up, and always get the 3 plates for ¬£10.25, great value good food, good drinks
Every year we make the journey to OT from Dublin and always have a great sing song in the Bishops! Great before and after the match
Good pub had the large breakfast which was served promptly and with a courteous service
No trip to Old Trafford would be complete without a visit. Great pub really good prices and unbelievable atmosphere on match days
Wonderful atmosphere with live screening for sports. They have a variety of craft beers which were excellent.

This is a great Wetherspoons.  Good food, large selection of drinks.  Good prices.

Wall to wall Manchester United paraphernalia and very good on match days.
For me it's the best bar in Manchester to go to for atmosphere before a man utd game pure class chanting

Good food so returned for breakfast which was even better.
Good value for money and good friendly service.
Singing as noisy as ever, the drink was flowing & the craic was ninety everyone in our group had a fantastic time....üíïüíï‚òòüëç ‚Ä¶
Spoons near Old Trafford. Packed on match days but relatively quiet other nights. Recently refurbished with nice toilets.
Most amazing atmosphere on match day!!!
Brilliant service the two young girls are excellent and lovely.very curteous too.
Great food good beer. Good service and very friendly staff good atmosphere. And good service
Great atmosphere before a match. You will need a membership or ticket to get in on match days however given the location
Friendly service and great food that was served in good time.
Excellent choice of drinks and food. Reasonable prices and lovely staff that look after you!
Food arrived quickly, piping hot, staff pleasant, pay them a visit
Great place to visit before watching a Manchester United match at Old Trafford. Fantastic atmosphere
Outstanding value here. I got a pint of craft ale for 1.79. Great service and friendly atmosphere.
We enjoyed a couple of peaceful breakfasts here before the cricket. Would definitely return.
Absolutely a place to visit if you are a manchester united supporter. Obviously. Nice People, spacious, Nice facilities and good seating outside.
Great pub Wetherspoons like no other next to old Trafford gets full of reds on match day nice staff well organised small amount of parking
Cheap food that's really nice, probably one of the best places to go for steak.
Good service great food but wouldn't want to try on a match day.
Very good food was good  barstaff  also were very attentive I would go again
Another Wetherspoons hit on the Chester Road and a stone's throw from Old Trafford. Good food and drink and friendly service.
Friendly staff  very quick service, food amazing. Lovely place for family or night out.
It was OK lovely staff practicing good social distancing foods ok its a wetherspoons so pretty much the same as them all including crockery
Awesome, the atmosphere when the MCU fans started singing the team songs was incredible!
Great pub, fantastic atmosphere, food is always spot on, staff are helpful and pleasant.
Great Breakfast the day after a great result üëç ‚Ä¶
Nice place and good customer service  people there so worm and welcoming
Great pub before a game make sure you have your ticket ready to show when going in.
Great atmosphere on match day,food and drink very good and reasonable
Great place to be for Man United fans..and others. Good food,good drinks and great athmosfare
Excellent services great prices.had a lovely meal whilst there loved it....
Great food,  great service,  hardly any waiting time
Great atmosphere on match days only tickets holders can get in on match days though I believe.
Great pub with lovely food. Worth a visit.
Great food good service great atmosphere.
Great man utd pub. Good food good atmosphere
Not usually my sort of pub but was well surprised
Beautiful day for Tony fantastic pub wonderful manager and staff xxxx

Always amazing food
Always clean. Excellent staff
Fantastic place, cheap and fantastic atmosphere.
Very good place to Eat and enjoy a Drink Great value and friendly helpful Staff
The energy here is just mind blowing! The perfect place to get charged up (if you are not already) before a game
Great pub for pre-match beers, get there early its always rammed! but worth it
Man united fan so a pleasure to see all the memorabilia.
If you go you won't be disappointed
Friendly staff nice food and drink cheap as chips
lovely atmosphere and even better food. 5  stars from me üëçüèª ‚Ä¶
Man United supporters bar...Tickets needed for match day entry but an unbeatable atmosphere

On a matchday, simply nowhere better. In fact, regarding the Bestie chant, I know where I'd be taking him for that eternal pissup
Always a great match day atmosphere
Nice food and great atmosphere. A must for united fans
always a great atmosphere on matchdays. well located near the stadium.
Very good service at the counter and when using the app. Good quality beers and food.
Match ticket to get in, few beers before match. Guaranteed match atmosphere
The food, drinks and service were perfect. Lovely friendly staff.
I go for Manchester united games and I love it. I rate this pub very highly ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Great food and service at reasonable price. Highly recommend A++
Great pints and craic and where we drink and sing for the greatest club in the world x
Great food and cheap beers and very friendly atmosphere
My son and I had a lovely experience here. The staff were lovely and friendly. Thank you
Fantastic place, close to old Trafford. Cheap and good food...
Good place, good food, good prices, great on matchday also

Really good service and beer

Great wetherspoons pub

Man utd memorabilia in the pub

The best preparty i ever been before a match game

The beer and service is excellent  top Mark's to Ben for his hospitality
Good food and good place to watch football.
Brilliant place on match days proper fans proper good staff and good food
Eat here all the time food is very nice,staff friendly

Good for food AndBT sports

Great place for drinks and beer before and after match.

Great food. Great service. Great prices.

Really great because it's not as busy as the other spoons!

Great food.

Great if you're a red, not so much if you're a blue.

Love this place, great staff and food

must try After a ManU game :)

Fantastic pub at the gates of Old Trafford. Ideal pre and post game place.
Good prices, variety of food and drink.
Pretty busy.

Nice pub near Old Trafford.
I ate a classic English breakfast and found it good.
The pub is part of the wheterspoon group so the menu is the same as all the pubs in this chain.
In case you want to eat, you have to sit down and see the table number, go to the cashier and say the table number and order, paying immediately.
The ordered food arrives after a few minutes.
The venue is clean.
Great food and drinks, unbelievable prices for England, it's just a shame I can't try the whole menu.

I recommend visiting the pub for local Manchester United fans, but the day before the match, on the day of the match, you have no chance to get to the pub and I recommend best in the colors of the club, i.e. red is best, I do not recommend in light blue like Manchester City üòâ otherwise, a beautiful exhibition of photos of Manchester United legends
Amazing atmosphere, great pub. I recommend it to every Man United fan.
Great beer prices and a nice Manchester United pub.
The best place in Manchester in terms of prices and atmosphere, very good beers and a wide selection of food, even with vegan options, a must!

My sister-in-law lived just a few houses away for a long time, so the visit was unavoidable.
But even now we have to go there at least once every time we visit Manchester.
The dishes are delicious and sumptuous. The price-performance ratio is simply great!
The four of us paid just over 50 pounds with a large drink.
The service staff are super friendly.

Since the pub is in close proximity to Old Trafford, the visit should be planned well so that it does not clash with a football match.
It's also worth seeing and fun, but then the food won't work.‚ò∫Ô∏è
Really nice place to have a drink, eat and watch a Manchester United game üëå ‚Ä¶
Every Manchester United fan needs a beer here. Good drinks, great atmosphere. Prices are quite low for Manchester. The food is tasty but not exquisite. I recommend.
A revelation, chicken tika masala and beef steak are the two best dishes in this place in my opinion
A cult place for United fans, although I personally prefer Trafford Bar üòâ ‚Ä¶
Nice pub right by the Manchester United Stadium.
Great BBQ burger, great atmosphere! Manchester United fans everywhere! :-)
A real classic place. I had the best English breakfast of my life here and the price was also very good.

A place with a nice atmosphere and very tasty food. Great waiter team. Full professionalism. One of the best places to spend time both before and after the match. Manchester United fans feel at home here. Burger and fries first class. Plus onion rings - amazing.

The best place to go before a Manchester United game. Please note: you only enter with a match ticket, you have to pay a small entrance fee and it is wise to be on time (otherwise there will be a long queue).

A place I visit regularly because of the very good "food". Not just this one place, the entire Wetherspoon chain offers good food at affordable prices and no matter where in the UK you're in, you'll always eat well and the quality is always the same. I recommend it even for family dinners.
Good atmosphere with MUFC supporters. ¬£1 entry
The place is ok, looks like all Wetherspoons, well lit but quite small. The service was great, everything was served quickly and nicely. I will definitely visit this place again üòä ‚Ä¶

Absolutely atrocious customer service. Aggressive workers with no respect for people who are paying for food and drink. Extremely hot - my friend nearly passed out due to the lack of cool air.

Disappointed of
1. no steaks at Saturday eve. Had to switch to Hamburger
2. No Mayonnaise availabe today....

We did not know that you have to order at the bar....took us some time to understand this.

Quite loud.
Don't know if it is a pub bar or bistro restaurant....
Served wrong drink and wouldn't replace. Had to buy another to prove it and got another free. Shocking customer service

Won't let you in on game days without showing your ticket to the match. I was with my mother and considering there's a music venue not too far away that we were going to later on, it's not ideal! Won't bother if I'm ever in the area again.

My local Wetherspoons, been in many Wetherspoons. 10 of us arrived, we went to the back, told we could not sit here, due to fire escape. The manageress moved to a large table by the entrance door.We had to ask for the table to be cleaned. After ordering, we asked for the door to be closed as we had a baby with us,plus many people smoking at the front door, and smoke coming in. The manageress, went past to another member of staff, and said "they can paiss off".
We paid ¬£85.00. My wife complained but no action do complained to head office.

Do not recommend coming here, staff are rude (managers)
We ordered a bowl of chicken wings and got delivered 3 more which were the table next to us which we gave back.
After their members of staff delivering the wrong food to the wrong table. We were not allowed to order anymore drinks to the table
Staff were rude when it came to addressing the situation.
Needs improving on basic customer service

Really disappointed! I came here with my family because used to love it but quality of the food has really gone down compared to last year. The pizza was flatbread topped up and the burger was tasteless, really thin, dry and plain. The half chicken was also very low quality. Not coming back.

I was asked my match ticket to go inside the pub. After I showed my ticket, I was not allowed to go inside because I was an away fan. Is it a Wetherspoon pub or is it belonging to Manchester United???????

Went to Old Trafford last week for the Brentford match and not for the first time the bouncer was very rude to me when I tried to get in this pub. I wasn't rude or drunk or anything like that, he said he 'didn't like my attitude'
I showed my ticket after the game tried to walk in and he grabbed my arm. I said excuse me what are you doing and this was when he said he didn't like my attitude
Have great memories of the atmosphere and craic throughout the years after United games but I certainly won't be rushing back if I ever go back!

Spent 3 weeks in Manchester working and staying at the Copthorn Hotel which is walking distance from The Bishop Blaize, so where else would I go for value food and drink.
I have travelled the country working away from home and have always used Spoons whenever possible for my sustenance because of the value for money they offer and have never had a problem until visiting this establishment.
First week I ordered the madras on the curry night and was asked if I wanted the option that included the mango chutney popadoms onion barji and nan bread which I opted for. When it came there was no mango chutney (which is still the case 3 weeks after) and the onion barji was totally cremated to the point it was inedible. I returned both mine and my colleagues asking the lady serving for replacements which we could eat and also enquired where the mango chutney was. The manager came over and said there was no chutney and informed us that the onion barjis were "coming out like that". He offered a 70p refund for the onion barji but nothing for the lack of mango chutney. When he returned with the 70p he slammed it on the table and walked of with no apology for the bad experience. TBC

Worst experience ever. In past have really enjoyed the place. Tonight my mate who's been every Tuesday for steak club arrived and gave the table number and asked for the rump steak like normal without looking through the menu. There's only one rump steak on the menu... Manager rolled his eyes, proceeded to patronise him and asked him to grab a menu. I was shocked by the ridiculous display put on by the manager. My mate laughed it off, ignored the rude behaviour and ordered a pint instead... Probably out of worry that spittle would contact his bargain beef but clearly, surely the manager was on one. Wait staff and management at this establishment have a lot to learn, if they don't know their own menu or recognise regular customers.

This place is staffed by "jobsworths"! They stopped serving food during events.. fair enough.. but to stop someone standing outside, where the smokers stand, to eat a subway sandwich is absolutely ridiculous! The door staff are morons who don't know anything about customer service!! You really need to review your hiring procedures Wetherspoons

No preparation for the influx of customers attending the Manchester half marathon. No milk for the tea we ordered. But also failed to inform us we could not have the scrambled eggs on toast we ordered and gave us fried instead which we did not want. No reimbursement offered forcrhe meal or tea we did not get. Had to have diet come instead. Really not happy.

Not enough staff AGAIN on a busy match day. 8 deep at the bar so ordered via that app and waited 40 minutes for a drink. What a missed opportunity to make lots of money. Put more staff on serve more people make more money. There must have been at least 10 people who walked out whilst we were waiting
Filthy womens toilets with ST on floor!!!...food below average, tuff grizly steak Black chips!!!! Service a joke.
No one allowed in on a match day unless you have a match ticket even United's own staff are not allowed in very disappointed

You need to buy the game tickets to get an entry, how ridiculous especially when the game starts in 15 mins and they wouldn't have much customers coming in !!!!

To add on, the security at the gate were trying to sell us tickets..lol
Probably a nice place but don't go there on a match day they charge you ¬£1 to get in and put the prices of drinks up
One of the staff was rude, the food was cold, the bread was stale, this is the first and last time I will ever be coming here.
no salt in whole restaurant? its tesco cross the road duh. Its unacceptable serving food without salt. Staff is not very helpful at all.
My experience at the bishop blaze was discussing the drinks was served warm and the service was not good the staff took way to long to deliver  orders to the table

Shocking customer service. Refused to serve me before local regular customer even though the LOCAL was behind me in queue.
Rubbish service
Wanted to nip in to wait for a fiend 30 mins after the game was turned away due to no match ticket! Very poor
Very friendly place for families with kids and good service I like going there üëåüëçüç∫ ‚Ä¶

Slowest service known to mankind... 20min wait?
More like. Hour an half wait
Didn‚Äôt even had my food as the service was that slow

Never go again
Probably ok not on a match day, however if you are there when United are at home it is a rip off joint.
Food very poor burger rock hard plus asked for tuna mayo panini got cheese and tomato panini,not how it used to be very let down
Very old decore and control of customers at tables bad at least one table had 9 people staff spoke to them three times but still did nothing about it

Ordered  breakfast it arrived cold, got a replacement breakfast no bacon.We were the only people ordering food and they still couldn't get it right.We were then informed there was a new member of staff in the kitchen needless to say won't be coming here again truly disappointed
No stars for this place unfortunately... can only order wine by the bottle not allowed to order a glass!!! Not good! Had to Giv it a 1 star as it won't let me post without a star!!
Nice food and drink  but the door lads are very unpolite and rude no different to pigs
Very poor bar staff ear wigging to our conversation 2 plus 2 making 22,ear wigging to a conversation so she won't be working in the pub game long.

Review Text: Breakfast, although very quickly brought out, was cold and overcooked.

Very much a football pub, but that close to the stadium that is kind of expected. Lots of screens if you do want to watch a match.
Staff accidentally overcharged us for mulled cider but we're okay correcting it by giving us drinks up to total paid.
I lost a hat and messaged the pub on Facebook but had no response. Not great as it's quite out of my way to go check.

Beer: great selection, only thing that kept us here
Food: far too many options for the kitchen to master, as it seems everything comes out tasting like burnt chicken.
Service: customers must order everything themselves at the bar, which is only a minor inconvenience compared to the electronic pay system the staff will allow you to use, charge your credit card, and then require you to pay in cash.

Bottom line: eat elsewhere, and come here after for drinks if you have cash on hand.
It's a Wetherspoons.... Disappointed that is said open until 12. But when we got there at quarter past 11 they had kicked out and weren't letting people in.
Never been here before and had the problems we had today took 3 times for our meals to come out correct service was shocking crnt say we got a proper appology üò° ‚Ä¶
Manchester  United  Whetherspoons. Cheap real ales ¬£1.99 when I went. Can be a bit rowdy due to the custom it attracts.
Ok yesterday. Not a good choice of beers that I did not expect however. I will leave it at that. Food typically Whetherspoon cold.
Took a while to be served and the bar was so messy ok to go for a drink when you argue with your girl if it's close.
Standard wetherspoons, too much Manchester United stuff though.
Average pub close to the 2x Old Trafford grounds
disappointing stadium tour, tour coordinator very poor
Place was clean and tidy  very busy as it was a game day. Service and staff were great. Plenty of places to sit  plenty of TV's. Guinness was absolutely garbage.
It's close to the O2 arena and not far from the Trafford Centre and Old Trafford football stadium. Despite it being a Wetherspoons the toilets weren't at the end of 3 hour maze.

Visited late afternoon today, quiet and quick service.
Must be a nightmare on a matchday as the bar is so small.
Although it was quiet the state of the tables was horrendous and when I asked the lady cleaning one of them to clean mine..she looked at me as though I was a piece of dog dirt, sprayed the table three times and proceeded to wipe 4 random spots not cleaning the table as she went snd then walked off, I watched her "clean" !! another table and move the chairs towards it at the wrong angle for the table..in a haphazard fashion.
The cleanliness of the gents was non existent however my wife said the ladies was fine.
Won't be rushing back.
the food was awful. Burnt. Won't be going back.
Cheap Beer, tick. Plenty tables and chairs, yes. Clean tidy? Not so much.

A good selection of ales on tap at very reasonable prices. The food is great and also very reasonably priced too. Would get five stars if it weren't for the fact that if there is a football match on at nearby Manchester United, they turn you away, yes even as a regular customer, if you are not a season ticket holder at Manchester United.
First time I've ordered a full english breakfast that doesn't come with black pudding. Had to order it at ¬£1.30 for two pieces......
Cheap drinks but a bit short on vibes. Great for a pint after work, or for a bite over lunch, though.
It's a good pub until match day when nearly all the tables and chairs disappear and the prices go up

Prices, quality of the food and atmosphere are comparable to other Wetherspoons pubs and as a non United fan, the paraphernalia that make up the decision didn't add anything to my experience, however I can imagine that it is a nice place to watch a match if you do support United. On my visit it was uncomfortably cold inside the pub but since that was the only visit, I if course don't know if that's always the case.
Beer was cheap but food was not good.
So far I think the worst one of wetherspoons pubs , the food really not as it should be even thinking about wetherspoons. The pub in general ok, decent staff, good prices obviously but that's all
Pretty small for a Wetherspoons. The app ordering was turned off and they'd ran out of quite a lot of meals. Poor experience

Smells weird in the bar and towards the back. Urine smell upstairs howeber Toilets appear clean. Food is the same standard as any other Wetherspoons.  Location is good. Can't comment on staff because i used the app but there were no issues.
It's just ok, not very clean especially toilets but what wetherspoons are 100%

Typical wetherspoons, reasonable food and an OK selection of beers. The app is fantastic, and service is pretty speedy. If anyone at Wetherspoons reads this, perhaps improve the burgers - they're quite dry, and the single piece of lettuce and tomato could be better.
Ok for a couple of drinks nit somewhere for a night out

A Wetherspoons that caters for the Old Trafford crowd, liked the pics of ex players on the walls. Limited real ales, kept well. It may have the feeling and atmosphere of a proper boozer, but the food was cooked well, and had the typical Wetherspoons value.
A well patronised Wetherspoon's   not much to say about the interior  as  nearly all are adequate or as we come to expect from Wetherspoon's  Staff very friendly
Quiet non match day not much atmosphere
Perfectly decent Wetherspoons, nice enough layout. I didn't have food and was drinking Sanpellegrino, my random criticism is the staff never offered me ice and a slice with this drink!
Was your average wetherspoons experience. Even though it's a man united pub and was a match day, food service was very quick and the atmosphere was quite welcoming
Nice food and nice place, affordable and good atmosphere.
Scruffy looking pub with a sticky carpet, can drunk outside though and really to both Old Trafford grounds. Decent for watching footy probably...
Decent pub and very good value food. Mayo is left at room temperate though. Avoid on match days.
Usually bouncing on match days, cheap enough drinks. That‚Äôs if the bouncer lets you in, thinking he‚Äôs top geezer cos I‚Äôve got a natural rough voice so I ‚Äòsound drunk‚Äô

Wetherspoons breakfast food as expected but still dirty glasses in serving hatch near the coffe machine from the night before suggested not the best hygiene but friendly enough staff been working near bye so been visiting once a week for two months no complaints with the food

Nice place though a bit chilly at times. There is an annoying loud noise that comes from the kitchen.
Downside is they can't cook eggs.

Good weather spoons, I believe it is a great Manchester United supports pub if you're a football fan

Food was ok, service was good
And enjoyed my evening.
Standard but often untidy pub near old Trafford. Good is you are a United fan.
Another decent spoon down marked a bit cos they put prices up on match days
If man u are playing you can't  go in unless you show a season ticket!! I had a ticket, but not season ticket holder!!üòûüòû ‚Ä¶
Went for breakfast when it came certain items were cold sent it back but no better when it came back we gave up and left most of it

Was nice food cold coffee but they soon sorted that out.

Nice pub but no heating. Everyone was wearing overcoats.
Fairly average spoons, and wasn't great ale.
Food was okay but they didn't get the order right for the food.

Decent pub food with reasonable prices

Standard Wetherspoons.
Nothing more, nothing less ü§£ ‚Ä¶

Not exceptional but worth a visit if you're in the area
A sports bar that is very large. Food is terrible and best avoided.

It's a weatherspoons it is what it is good for United games
Busy pub.  Came in to watch football one evening whilst staying nearby

my local, it's alright, nice staff!

Standard Wetherspoons experience, cheap beer, generic pub.
Plastic glasses. Must've been as Test Match was on

Reviewer Name: Syed Shahzad ul Hassan ali shah Bukhari

Review Text:
Rapid service and great atmosphere when the football is on
Food is fine‚Ä¶ standard spoons offering
Bit of a queue on a match day so get there early
Great atmosphere, well organised for the  Rugby League grand Final
Very handy for Old Trafford. Matchday pricing in effect but does real ale and is cheaper than pub across the road.
Solid pub, went for Arsenal vs United away game to watch. Drinks and food very cheap, thought the atmosphere would be a bit rowdier, but it was fine.
I have only had breakfast here and it is amazing! Fast service, great portions and the food is great. I always come here when in Manchester multiple times. I absolutely love it!
Had breakfast there, before attending a Lancashire cricket match. Short walk to the cricket ground from here. Food was very good and the staff friendly.
Not bad for a local pub, food isn't the best to be honest, service is good, friendly staff, can get very busy some days.
Match day visit place was packed great atmosphere really close to the old Trafford football ground
Good spoons right next to Old Trafford. 50% hit on poached eggs...2 Benedict's ordered, my eggs were solid & the Mrs was spot on!
Just called in for a beer on a non-match day. Quiet. Match day it's heaving and charges entry

Decent spoons and close proximity to old Trafford so gets a lot of footfall on match day either for cricket or football. Staff cope well with the demand and security staff and bar staff are very friendly. It's a good place to watch the sport. Drinks are cheap as well.
Didn't eat there, had good time pre match drinks,good atmosphere
Lively Wetherspoons close to Old Trafford. Very busy. Especially on match days. Good atmosphere, and excellent Wetherspoons prices. Nowhere nearby comes close to value for money. Well worth a visit
Great pub very busy for food though so beware eat elsewhere
Nice place, nice atmosphere and nice and cheap food!

This is a wetherspoon so great beer prices. Just a few hundred metres from Old Trafford football ground. Match day door fee of a ¬£1 each is more than made up for by the cheap bar prices. Outside terrace and seats for smokers.
Called in after going to sign book of condolences at Old Trafford F C.
Just an average spoons, 1 of the cheaper in Manchester not too far from some football ground  the team wear Red apparently?
Top bar for footy but no seats inside on matchday

This place has character, just round corner from Manu ground. Loved pictures around the place.
Visited before season started so could only imagine the atmosphere on match days. Staff very nice and curry night was amazing.
1st time there. A  great experience.  Food was great
Small pub for a Wetherspoons. Had a bottle of white wine between us, enjoyed the atmosphere
Fairly lively and well located close to old Trafford. They'd a great selection of alcohol on tap.
Lovely atmosphere, clean, not too noisy, food was lovely and not to dear. The staff were kind and helpful üòä ‚Ä¶
Nice welcome and cider from the Hogs Back 5 miles from my local the tilly shilling where they don't have it
Right next to Old Trafford. Good old spoons!
Lovely service, good food! Shame there is no music...

Great British pub experience to be had here. They have a large selection of beers, and ales and always have several special priced tap beers and ales. The menu has a very good selection and there are specials every day. The food was very good and breakfast here is excellent. The prices are very reasonable and the place is very clean. Like most pubs you order and pay at the bar. I was told on game days if you are not a Manchester United fan club member, you can't get in.

Great breakfast here in a Wetherspoons that was bright and well lit, and with pleasant staff. Would have given it five stars if it hadn't been for the bacon, which was so thin you could almost see through it. It certainly wasn't thick enough to stick a fork in and the fork would pick it up. Trying to pick up the bacon on a fork was rather like trying to pick a piece of paper up by sticking a fork in it. Impossible. Anyone who frequents Wetherspoons knows what to expect. It's cheap, so we get what we pay for. But this morning's bacon was even thinner than usual. To be fair, given the current inflation rate, perhaps the thinner bacon is a better option than putting the price up, but only four stars today I'm afraid.
Game day has a great atmosphere for a few drinks before a game and a good sing song. Need to have a match ticket to get entry on match days though.

Nice place, very friendly staff. Except on match days, bouncers on the door won't let regulars in. You need a match ticket to get in. Not fair for the regulars who would like to watch the match there. The regulars keep this place going out of season and when United are not playing at home.

One of the decent Wetherspoons within Greater Manchester (Trafford). Decent food, drink choices and moderately cheap. It's near impossible to get in on match day but if you do get in, prepare to be waiting some time to get served (they have an app where you can have table service which may make things easier) but also enjoy it as the atmosphere in there on match day is electric.
Good pub is the bishop, 5 minutewalk from Old trafford. Its a weatherspoons so standard spoons pricing and choice but all staff were sound
Always a cheap and cheerful place to go. Great atmosphere on match days
Typical wetherspoons pub, nice and cheap.

The Blaize is a decent spoons pub, but much more enjoyable on a non match day unless you like queuing to get into pubs. It's pretty inside and always quite busy no matter what's going on. Handy to drink in if you fancy a few cheap pints before going down to the cricket ground, but loud and jam packed when United are playing if that's what you like.
Good beer and the food looked great... A little "Airport Lounge" feel to it, but considering how Close to both Cricket and Football grounds, and how busy they get... decent enough...

Gud whether spoons. Very busy but it's the best I've been in yet. Good service,  plenty staff on behind the bar. Only a small beer garden thou. Would go in again n again. Better than stalybridge or Hyde .
Food menu was limited compared to usual Spoons availability. But overall well maintained

Usual wetherspoon experience,  dirt cheap beer and good enough cheap food. The pizza is lovely.

Cheap and simple weatherspoons franchise. Cheap range of beers and simple food. Good spacious inside dining area and nice outside seating (weather permitting)
